transcript.content: Oh yeah, the smooth indie sound of Richard Ashcroft "Science of Silence" on Xfm 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, joining me is Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington.
It was an excellent link that, Rick. Did you say nime at one point? One oh four point nime?
Other than that it was textbook.
Again, I- I- yeah, desperate attempt at being articulate.
See here's the good thing about the boxing thing, because er- there's no chance of me... you know, er slurring me words.
No, no. I already slurred my words.
So no- any damage will be totally fine. Oh dear.
The doctor's rushing in, "I think there might be some kind of concussion."
Jane just going, "No, that's just the way he talks."

But erm, but er- cause I'm thinking maybe did you start the show with- with that particular kind of er manner, just cause obviously a lot of new listeners, I imagine, thanks to the massive poster campaign and you obviously want to impress them with your charm.
See now that there- there's a few examples today of irony coming back and bitin' ya.
That- that seemed like a funny idea at the time, me posing like 'at, but erm- Jonathan Ross phoned me up when they first went up and he said, "I've just seen a big poster of a predatory gay."
Yeah, you do look a little bit er-
"Would you like to sit down here?"

And then you're in the background. And also er-er- the- the- I think the funny thing about having you as a partner, I mean the only good thing is that y-y-you know, you look- you look weird and tall, like too freakishly tall and lanky.

But in that one, no because you're background and you're smiling you don't look as weird as you do in real life, or as- as freakishly tall. So it sort of ruins it a little bit for me. Look at, look at that-

He's not listening he's just opening the f- er packet, what are they? McVities? See- er wha- see we should mention them we could get some free ones. If anyone at McVities are listening. Cause we're not gettin' the perks of this.
Not at all. I'm- I- I'll tell ya I'm not getting anything. I really got in this game for er the ladies, for the money, for the voiceover work-
Certainly not seeing hide nor hare of that.
But erm, you're not getting the voiceover work cause Jethro, the Jethro is gettin' all of his parts that you might get.
Erm okay Rick, yeah. You are the voice of what, the drink driving campaign?
You sound, you sound like a man who was run over in a drink driving accident.
I mean it's like, you don't drive-
Yeah but I didn't make any money from that did I?
Or did I? I can't remember. Yeah
It's like I'mean talk about the kettle calling the pot black
I don't drive, yeah. But that's good it's don't drink and drive. No it said don't drink and drive so I've chosen just to drink.
But at least I can formulate sentences using the English language and I'm not gettin' the voiceover work what- what's- wh- what-
Yeah the English language of the 14th century.
What is that! Better a English language- an English language.
Not the, whatever kind of middle England language you speak. The language of the hobbits.

I can't believe it! Are you bored with us already? D'ya know what? MTV called me last week, they called me again yesterday and said when can they come down to do a- oh they're coming down next Saturday, by the way, to do a little screen test for ya. They're gonna sort of just film you with a little camcorder. You said this, they're gonna film ya… Are you alright? D'ya want- I mean- are you hungry? Do you wanna go out and have a meal? I can't believe you're eating while I'm on air.
Do you know who I am?
Er that's Ricky Gervais, right? He's made his name on TV.
Okay, he's done any number of corporate gigs which- and they pay silly money.
So I mean, this guy's earning, you know and really er- earning beyond his talent.
So I think I deserve a little bit more than a little Manc eating a biscuit while I'm talking.
Just a little bit of respect?
Karl, what have you won? What have you won?
Well the thing- I- I got a errr I got a- got a bronze certificate for doing a full week at school.
And er- and I got me a little crusader's badge if you- if you remember.
Crusader's badge for the religious club, so-
Oh is that the fella where you played ping pong ball-
Where you had to go to-
And then they wanted to talk to you about God?
You got a crusader's badge, did you?
Yeah, that's why I went, that's why I joined, that's why I joined.
I liked- i liked the little badge. Did 4 weeks then packed it in. But er- we were talking about MTV, right? And I was feelin' a bit nervous wan't I? About... about like, you know the way I look.
And wha' have ya. And then I watched a bit of Celebrity Big Brother and all the fuss that Mark Owen's gettin' and he's not- he's not that good looking is he?
He's- he's very- I- I- I like wanted to be Mark Owen's mate. If anybody knows Mark Owen or if Mark Owen's listenin' I wanna be his mate.
I think he's a nice lad but what I'm saying is, right, all the girls go mad over him.
And he's not- he's not that good looking is he?
Well, no he's got a- he is in a certain way isn't he? That sort of er- non threatening sort of-
Yeah but he's not- he's not stunnin' is he? D'ya know what I mean?
Well what's your definition of stunning?
Someone who you look at and you go, "God they- they're good looking."
Well- well who- wh- what bloke do you think's attractive then?
So if I was into men...
In fact, you can still say a blokes a good looker without like fancying him.
Who- who do you think is attractive?
Oh... I mean it depends what you're looking for.
Ricky, Steve and Karl talk simultaneously
Who would you say, is like, stunning in your definition?
Good looking lad. Er, okay there's... errr... ooo...
D'ya find ya know, Robbie Williams, do you find him attractive?
No, no. Who d'ya- Karl, hurry up cause it's, you know, we've only got 2 hours.
D'you know, I-- I can't think of one offhand, Mark Owen is- is pretty good looking then, really. Ehh...
What there's not- just name one bloke that you think's an attractive guy. There must be one bloke that you've either met or that you've, you know, seen in a pub. Or-
Tell ya what, erm, works here, erm, young Alex Zane.
Ooooo,! Ooooo little Alex! Ooo I love you Alex! Oooooo!...
Brilliant. I love that. That- that's like erm a Ride song or summat.That's my favourite track.
Ride-ish, Feeder "Just the Way I'm Feeling" on Xfm 104.9.
I'm thinking erm a lot of people may- maybe tuning in for the first time cause of the advertising campaign.

Should we re-introduce Karl again? I know- I know we've done this a few times in the past but just worried that people are gonna not, you know, not really kind of get the measure of him if they're new listeners.
I'm- I'm- I'm yeah, let's do it, I'm Ricky Gervais er,the one off The Office.
Steve Merchant, he's not the one in The Office, he's not- he's not Gareth. Some people think he is, he's got a funny, weird, West Country accent.

For the role. Steve er wrote it with me. He's tall erm lanky fella. Er, Karl is our erm sort of I say producer but he's the one that presses the buttons because I'm just too... Yeah, but I mean it was just cause I was too big to run the desk.
Erm, like I used to have to do it.
Heh, Literally too big, you couldn't...

And then we discovered that, you know, he looked a bit like a boring sort of (in Manc accent) "Alright? Yeah." But then when we sort of st- you know poked him with a stick he came up with erm er he doesn't realize but some of the, I think some of the funniest things...
Some of the most extraordinary things you've ever heard.
Well classics, I think, so far gone straight to the list include, "Have you ever used a Y-front correctly?"
Er you never see an old person...
Eatin' a Twix. These are the sort of things. Er he- he's back on his campaign to get rid of jellyfish. Why is that, Karl?
Awww did you see the paper yesterday?
It's about... 15 foot long, 'bout 5 foot wide.
And er, there's a fella swimmin' next to it and the paper's going all, "Look at this we've found, there's loads of 'em in Japan."
Erm and it's cos they all- they er the water's gettin' hot so it's making jellyfish really big.
Oh dear. How is the campaign going to get jellyfish rid, you know, get rid of 'em?
What- what's your point about jellyfish? Just they don't do anything?
There's no point, they get in the way, they ruin me holiday.
Cos I got stung by one.
But you think the same thing about Liverpudlians and we can't just go around, you know, wiping out things that ruin your holiday.
Well let's do the jellyfish first and then we'll move onto the Scousers.
Erm, but yeah, I dunno what they do. And I'm still- I mean I'm trying to look on the internet, I mean I've been busy this week.
You're on jellyfish now, not Scousers?
You don't know what the difference is.
I don't know what they do either.
To try and work out what would happen with the sea if it didn't work cos they say like if there's no-

Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa. See that is what we're talking about, people listen  the first time they've gotta listen to every word you say. You wanna find out what would happen with the sea if it didn't work?
If- if- if jellyfish weren't in there, d'ya know what I mean? Cos stuff like corral, apparently the sea would be in a right state if you didn't have any corral, innit?
Erm... If fish, d'ya know what I mean, I always worry about how many fish we're sort of eatin' cos you go past...
No, D'ya know like you go in Marks and Spencers or Selfridges and it's all-
There's loads of fish in there.
And there's really fancy stuff that you think they've killed that and it looks good on the counter, pretty impressive.
But is anyone gonna buy it?
D'ya know what I mean? It's a big like a shark sat in ice.
And you go, "Yeah, they've got- they've got like a lot of fish for sale..."
Are you sure you weren't going round the Tate Gallery? what-
But, d'ya know what I mean? It's in Selfridges.
Well I've never seen a big shark sat in ice in Selfridges.
They do. They do it. And then it's like you go in the morning and you can go back at night and the same shark's sat there and it's- it's-
You know it's the same shark d'ya?
You sure he just hasn't lost his mum and he's just like he went shopping for the Christmas shopping and he's just like stranded, he don't know where- he's just waiting.
I've never seen a shark in Selfridges.
Well, alright then say maybe that's one day a week but another day it's like-
Shark Monday, I think y-y-yeah at Selfridges, "Today at Selfridges it's Shark Monday."
So your point is that there's all these fish not being eaten.
So, they're takin' 'em out of the sea, no one's eatin' 'em...
And you're worried what that the sea's gonna rise cause the more things you take out...
Well I just dunno if it's gonna rise.
Cause they- cause the fish drink it, don't they and that keeps the water level down.
No but you know- you know what I mean there's stuff- there's stuff at work...
Was it you that said that you're worried that cause, you know, there's sponge in the sea.
That if they took it all away-
Is that Steven Wright? What's the joke?
Yeah, sponges grow in the sea, that kills me, how deep would it be if they didn't?
I love the fact that he confused you with Steven Wright who- who for a living purposely says ridiculous things.
Well think about that and play a record.
What d'ya want? What d'ya want?
Oh, I'd love to hear a classic, a beautiful song by Simon and Garfunkel "April Come She Will."
Simon and Garfunkel - “April Come She Will”
"April Come She Will" Simon and Garfunkel.
That was in the days when they kept songs short.
What d'ya think of that, Karl? As a track?
Yeah, it's a good one, yeah.
Yeah excellent. Erm so yeah so er- that- that's erm- that's Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Coming up on the show we've got Educating Ricky...
Oh really? Cause the last few weeks have been genius.
What is there- is there a drop in quality is there, of the education of me?
It's just like I said I've wasted a lot of time this week searching on the web, right? Er...
You wasted a lot of time searching on the web because you come up with things that aren't true. Why don’t you look in books and verified sort of like journals...
The web is the new book though, innit?
The web is the new book.
It is, it’s a new library. So I've been searching there's hardly anything. I spoke to ya in the week.
What did you say? There's nothing happened this week in the world apart from…
There's nothing going on there was a new car wash that you can put dogs in.
There was a car wash you can put dogs in?
He said that's the only thing that's happened in the world.
And that and the jellyfish but we've covered that so...
So we've got- yeah- we- we’ve- I’ve managed to find some bits but it's not that good. Erm Rockbusters...
Yeah you- you've really G’d up, so that's coming up, the thing that's not that good...
Yeah, yeah look forward to that.
Could you just quickly tell us about the car wash for the dog innit as that...
I don't know what's the story?
They didn't make the top three.
I di- I didn't- I didn't waste that much time on it to be honest.
It just said erm, you know, “How busy are ya? Er, have you got a dog?”

Erm “How about saving some time. There's some car wash out erm... it's- it’s not a car wash it's a dog wash.” Erm... you take it down there, put your coin in, put your dog in, and it comes out clean. See there's nothing in it.
Is this- is this called a bath? Isn't it?
No but it's like a machine.
There's a machine. But- but we'll le- you know, that's why I didn't pick it.
So we've got- we've got some bits coming up. Er, Rockbusters.

Rick can I just er... can I just explain some of the prizes we've got here for Rockbusters? Because I just want you to try and picture, if you would, the kind of Xfm listener who'd particularly want this collection- this collection of- of- of gifts.
You've got the erm, the best chill-out album ever, this is the one as I've said before that's largely made up of songs you may have heard in adverts.
So you've got the erm- the Volvo advert on there...

That's on there, so erm- that's some right songs so look forward to that. Erm... yeah again just- just imagine which Xfm listener is particularly looking forward to Top of the Morning with Terry Wogan...
His er- two disc set there. You got er- it starts with erm- er- The Bangles on there we've got Billy Joel "River of Dreams" er "Shine On" by Mr. Chris de Burgh, so erm...
So just look forward to that er...
We've got the Only Fools and Horses last year's Christmas special. We gave one of those away last year- er last week but er- still more to er, shift.
Is there- is there- do I spy a little three… car?
And yes a little three-  three wheel trotter independent er training three wheel car so...
So that's there as well. So erm- as ya say if you- if you like fairly er- good comedy.
And little little Jonathan Ross's face there.
And er- maybe you also want er... Geri Halliwell's "Body Yoga" DVD Rick, so erm.
Sure yeah well that's good quality.
And then just a few token er- Xfm kind of things. We've got er The Manic Street Preachers DVD and er- the U2 Best of...
And er- tell me Steve how do er- the lucky winner- er listeners win these?
Rick, I'm glad you've asked. What they do is they email in with the answers to Rockbusters which is a quiz to...
Hold on- hold on though how do they email if they don't know the email address?

Rick, again, thanks for asking thanks for flagging that up. Erm- [email protected] That will be coming up shortly. Erm- try and get into the mindset of Karl Pilkington. A lot of people have been trying to email in answers trying to think through kind of logically.
Or maybe based on the rules that they've picked up over the years.
Or when he says it's a cryptic clue they believed him.
So er- you've just got to think more like a mentalist to try and get it.
Right, first of all, right, the prizes that I source every week...
Erm, what I've said to you we're doing between now and Christmas, cause there's just a few weeks til Christmas...
I thought I'd make up sort of family packs...
That erm- the winner can have something, say like erm- there's a nice U2 album in there right? So the winner might wanna keep that. But they can get rid of the Geri yoga thing...
They can give Only Fools and Horses to an uncle...
To the dad, yeah. The mum- I think the mum would love the Terry Wogan.
Yeah, yeah. The yoga for your sister.
So is that- that- is that what you thought through was it? Or- or was it that there was a load of junk in the office?
Did- or- or did you scoop em up with two arms and this is as much as you can carry down the corridor?
But that's me er- that's me workings on why we've got all that.
Er that's coming up erm- what?
And me- and me mum's sent some more.
What we also need you to know is...
Let him- he's got a little- he's got a letter from his mum.
Me mum did some more Rockbusters for us.
I reckon- I reckon they're secretly listening Karl. They've said they're not listening but I reckon they are.
Well let's play a record and let's hear erm- let's hear your mum's Rockbusters.
Karl, well done mate, well done.
I hope so, I hope so.
Nirvana "You Know You're Right" on Xfm 104.9. I had to er... meet the er- doctor for the- for this fight thing in the week and er- er- it's the one who's off erm... Big Brother.

Yeah. and erm- but she's a medical doctor she's sort of erm- ya know er- big in the- in the boxing sort of world as well. And erm- one of the tests, I had to do a punch test, the other test I had to do was to get in the Bod Pod ya know...
Yeah, yeah and er- I was a little bit nervous and er-
So what does this do? What exactly does it do the Bod Pod?
What it does is it er- you do er- erm- a- a displacement sort of calibration with a known volume.
Alright just bear in mind that Karl's listening so you wanna explain that in...
Ok what it does Karl is it works out your density.
Thr- thr- through displacement it knows how much your- what your volume is for the air displaced, right, in this- in this thing. And erm...
In layman's terms what does it tell you?

Er- it- it tells you- well it knows- well it knows- it knows what muscle weighs, it knows what fat weighs, it knows you average density, of y-y-y-your skeleton, er- what height you have in there. So it works out from your volume and your density erm- it can work out therefore probably what percentage of that is muscle, fat, bone, et cetera.
W-what if you put in one of those erm-
No go on what were you gonna ask what- what-
J-just what would it do if you put in one of those pug dogs?
Put in one of those what?
What do you mean what would it do?
Do you know those dogs that are all wrinkly and have got too much skin for the skeleton?
And it's all like caving in and folding over?
Would the machine go, "Well we know what you are so it's alright?" Or would it say, "Oh what's going on here?"
D'ya know what I mean? Like last week when you were like having a go...
Why would you- why do you wanna confuse machines? D'ya remember when he put in "Why" into a computer search engine to try and confuse it? I love the fact...
I wanted the computer to come back, "Why not?" and your head explode. I mean I love the idea that you're trying to wha- what I mean di-
It's better than what I thought you were gonna say which is, "What if you put a fly in there?"
So anyway what percentage of you is muscle and what percentage of you is fat?
And my- and most of me is muscle. Erm- er- bone density and that. Rik Waller was 60% fat which I've looked into it and apparently it's exactly the same as a pork scratching.
The equivalent of a 30 stone… pork scratching.
A living… yeah, of a giant pork scratching.
So erm- is 20% fat is that good or bad?
I- I erm- men, healthy, fit, lean men erm are about 18, 20. Erm-
Right, so you're a healthy, fit, lean man?
Erm over. And a boxer- a boxer that- that is in peak ya know with the basically you've seen the ones they just look ya know, like Bruce Lee.
Erm- well I don't think it's that bad for ya, I mean, ya know you need er- fat.
Cause Bruce Lie- Bruce Lee supposedly er- I mean there's many rumours, I'm sure you're fascinated by them Karl, conspiracy theories surrounding Bruce Lee's death.
One of which is that he- his body was in the peak of physical perfection, he had an aspirin cause of a headache and it reacted with his- his- just the impurities in the aspirin killed him.
I love that he- cause it- cause it's sorta like quite interesting and a bit weird.
Well are you aware of the fact that supposedly he actually cheated death? He actually faked his own death so he could work undercover for the Hong Kong police. You aware of that?
Do you believe that as well? Not so su- not so convinced.
Do you believe he can kill a man by puttin' all his energy into a trembling hand and touch him and every blood vessel burst?
Well it's just another form of trickery, innit? I mean you met up with er- with Derren didn't you?
Yeah he's incredible he's probably Britain's best illusionist if you don't mind me saying.
He can put that on the poster if he wants.
Tell you what though, right? Changing the subject a bit…
we're talking about a fly gettin' in that pod.
Erm- read in the week when I was searching for stuff to educate ya know the educate Ricky section.
You wanna answer that phone cause it's annoying me.
I dunno it's obviously someone who doesn't know that you're talking at the moment so leave it.
Finish your point, let him finish his point.
It could be- it could be erm-
It could be the head of...
It could be the head of Xfm?
(in high pitch voice) Oh I'm so scared. I'm Ricky Gervais I've got awards but I'm really scared. We must answer the phone.
No, no, no. I wanna embarrass him on air going, "Don't call me when I'm working."
Nice. High five. Raging against the machine.
Right so we were talking about flies…
Gettin' in the pod and d'ya know like how erm... a Barbie doll if it was real it wouldn't be able to work? D'ya know what I mean? A Barbie doll if a woman had the...
Yeah, she wouldn't be able to tie her shoelaces up an' stuff cos her legs are too long for her back an' all that. Flies, scientists can't work out how they fly.
It's a bee. It's a bee not a fly.
A fly is- apparently its body is like too big for its wings, and erm- they still can't work it out.
Which in your mind says what? Something spooky?
They- they have worked it out they...
It's the fact that what they do the- the- the wing actually beats a ridiculous- about 150 times a second. So it displaces air.
So they have worked it out.
I know what you mean. I know what you mean it's- it's incredible that it can fly cause it has such small wings.
And it's a bee not a fly.
Yeah, but other than that, good point.
Aw, another classic, "Be My Wife" off the Low album, David Bowie.
Rick, I- you know my frustration with the homeless.
You know they wind me up.
Walking through So Ho last night I saw a homeless fella reading a book.
Well I'll tell ya this, if he's got the where with all to read a book...
Right, he's obviously, ya know, he- he wants to keep himself occupied- his mind occupied, his mind educated.

My point is, why not, instead of reading a book, have a quick look through the job vacancy section of the Evening Standard? Or maybe just take the time to fill in some kind of application form for, ya know, maybe... ya know er...a job or something like that.
See what you're confusing there is the- is the-
No no no no no no.
Is the- is the ability to read with the ability to house yourself.
Well no because what I'm saying is it seems to me he's obviously got a certain, ya know, grasp psychologically of ya know his where with all...
They're not mental, people who haven't got houses
Well, a lot of 'em are, Rick.
I see them dancing and shouting and screaming ya know and pissing in doorways and stuff.
Yeahyeahyeah, you're confusing homelessness with trampiness.
Some people just have left home and they haven't got a-
Listen, Gervais I'm not a sociologist.
Sorry if I can't spot all the clever distinctions...
...that a trained expert such as yourself can.
All I know is there was a fella reading a book.
Well ya know- ya know the ones that have got beards...
...and sing little tunes, and they smell of piss, right.
They're my favourite, they're my favourite, they are brilliant.
Ya know the ones that sit with a dog or sell the issue? They just- they just haven't got their own place.

Ok. Well again I mean there's a- cause I- it is tricky finding a place, I know cause I had to move house recently and it's a nightmare. I had to get like estate agents on it and I had to go and see a load of places and I was doing a job as well, ya know, and I still managed to fit it in. These guys just loungin' around on the street.
So I'm surprised they can't find a place.
He should've have found loads of places to live.
I'm surprised he can't find the time to visit a couple of different residences.
Cause there's some pretty cheap ones ya know, if you go kind of a bit farther out of London. Maybe it's cause he wants to live in the So Ho area and frankly it's expensive.
I don't- what I'm confused about is the number of homeless people that recognize me and say they enjoyed The Office.
They've gotta be watching it through Dixon's window.
I think that's probably the demographic that's sort of hung over from some of your previous TV work.
Yeah, ya know, or stuff like that or...
The one that used to set fire to.
So yeah. Or maybe sort of people who watched ya know have watched the show and then have fallen on hard times since then, I don't know. They're not necessarily linked.
No I wouldn't- I wouldn't have thought so. Karl's lost. Karl's lost in this conversation. Karl, are we boring you then?
No no no it's just er... I dunno it's a bit tight innit?
Cos it's like I- I sometimes think it could have been me when I- when I see a homeless people an' that.
I just think, ya know, I nearly killed a man once, it could have totally changed me life.
So whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa
Yeah, you wanna slow down mate, just wanna back up for a second.
No that time when I was in Wales, right, and I picked up a big piece of slate and chucked it off the cliff.
Alright? And it nearly hit a fella.
Right in that split second if he would have decided to sort of go and pick up a shell that was close to the sea...
He- he- he- it could have hit him.
I would of killed him and I- and I wouldn't be sat here today.
So it's just all about luck innit?
D'ya know what I mean? So... er... dunno that's about it really that's- that's...
Is that the point? It's a political social point.
So what is the point? There but- but for the grace of God goes I.
Yeah, no he's saying- he's saying, ya know, we should count our blessings because, ya know, anything can happen.
Ya never know what's around the corner.
It's like if Karl hadn't met us he'd still be in a little room making jingles. Now he is a respected household name.

Do you think he packed the book before he left home to become homeless? He thought, "Right, I'm gonna need the clothes, I'm gonna need the cigarettes, I'm gonna need the dog and the piece of string, and I'm probably gonna need some- probably gonna need some reading literature as well cause I'm gonna get pretty bored like just sittin' in the street begging all day."
Yeah. D'ya know maybe it's- maybe-
Or maybe I should take- I wanna catch up on some of the stuff I haven't read, ya know.
Or maybe it's one of those themed holidays, ya know the trendy middle class people?
They go on like adventure the holidays and danger holidays and... maybe then the latest one amongst sort of like yuppie types...
They they they pay like 10 thousand pounds...
And they really get the experience.
They get a little area on the streets of So Ho.
And people come up to them and abuse them.
They're- they're all shouting- they're all actors, yeah.
They get beaten up at night when they're sleeping under a bridge.
They- they- they ya know, they get to try a really safe sort of form of heroin.
That sounds brilliant though. That's- that's worth marketin' Rick.
Themed holidays like that- you can have homeless...
You can have like rent boy holidays.
Find out what it's like to be a rent boy for 3 weeks.
Yeah and the- yeah and the-
And make a little bit of money on the side.
They have to wean 'em off it.
You- you- you're a bank manager again.
I've just got the taste for it, to be honest.
No, it's worth knowing if that- if that is a possibility.
Look Karl. Look, Karl's worried. What? We haven't said anything.
We didn't say anything, we were just talking about a possible holiday.

Travis, on XFM 104.9.  I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant, and Karl Pilkington.  We're doing Educating Ricky.  Right, final one.  Come on, Karl.

People who have tattoos, I've never understood it.  Right, that they have something put on their arm.
Right, sorry, have we started the educate.. is this part of it?  Are you educating me, this is something that will be useful in my life, that I didn't know about..

You come up with a design you want, and you sort of, this machine scans it, and uh.. you put your arm in this thing, and you press 'print' or whatever, and then it does the tattoo on your hand, or on your arm..
What, like loads of little needles that follow a pattern.
Is it a real tattoo, it's a..
It's a proper one.  The fella said, uh..
Well as long as it goes.. pierces the skin with the..
I just wondered if it was one of those kind of, you know kind of..
No it must be lots of little needles, or moving needle that can..
Sorry, but how is this cleaned? Like in between each person?
Well no, if it's one needle it's just the head, isn't it?  If it it's one needle that moves, does it like a..
What are we gaining from a machine doing it?
Just because you know they not gunna sort of mess it up.
But hold on, how would you keep your arm still?  'Cause your skin moves slightly, so a machine won't..
It sort of strapped to your arm.
And the fella said that the tricky thing was in all this, it was the fact that, you know nobody would let him test it out anyone else, so he had to do it himself.

But did it work?  Because the thing is with a tattoo artist, they can see when your skin's moving, they can see what they've done, they keep wiping it and looking.  Whereas a machine's just got to trust itself.
So, I think one needle would, could do wrong.  If it was a lot of needles that it just came down, you know like a thousand needles that was an imprint..
But obviously I'm asking someone who hadn't delved any further than 'there's a machine that can give you a tattoo'.  That's all you've got at the moment, isn't it.
I mean that's what I've got, because I'm not a fan of tattoos, I don't..
But where did you read this again?
This was on the Internet, yeah it was.
And uh.. I just don't understand why people do it.  That's what got me attention, 'cause me, umm..
Sorry what have I learnt from this?
That if you wanted to get one, you know you can get one done by a machine now.
People say machines have sort of taken over and that, and there's another one.  But it's just the fact, I mean I dunno, I..
So give us the snappy of this education again.
Why don't they just get a diary or some paper or something to write it on.

That's what I always think when I see people with loads of tattoos.  Like there's that fella who we were talking about the other week in Scotland who was covered ninety-nine percent in tattoos.  It's just like, what have you done that for?
D'you know what I mean you can't get rid of it now, you've done it now.  One of my uncles right, Tattoo Stan.
I don't think he's me proper uncle, but it's just like me dad's..
Tattoo Stan.  That's a province in Russia isn't it.
Me dad's got loads of mates who, right..
When you say he's not your proper uncle..
Just a bloke who used to hang around..
..when someone comes 'round you're like, "alright, Uncle Stan".  D'you know what I mean?  And there's like, there was uh.. me dad had loads of mates like that.  There was John the Screw.
So he either worked in a prison, or he liked to have sex.
There was Jimmy the Hat.  I'd know what..
There was uh.. there was Fred the Veg.
Are you sure he wasn't a relative?
Fred the Veg used to get us like big bags of potatoes and that.
And there was Tattoo Stan.  And was just caked in them and I used to always look at him and thinking, why have you done that.  I must have only been like, you know, six or seven..
I 'spose if you're born with a name like Tattoo Stan..
And were they like a 1950's gang, who were just like..
What was his name, the Hat?
I'm worried about Jimmy the Hat, not having a hat.
Are you sure he didn't have a hat?
Did he ever wear a hat?
I didn't see him that much.
D'you think it was a joke like you know when you mates sort of like, eight foot and huge and you call him..
What, the fact he never wore a hat..
Yeah they went, 'hold on, I've noticed something about Jim'. 'Go on'. 'No hat'.  And they go, 'oh true, let's call him Jim the Hat'.
Jimmy the Hat, yeah.  But me uncle Stan he had like loads of them, he did them himself.
..'cut here' one, on the neck.  And if you're gunna go them yourself I'd say at least made sure you're sort of a good drawer.
And don't do it in a mirror so it comes out backwards.
Well that was the other thing but like I remember he did.. I mean names are alright but he was like all his kids names down his arm.
What were they called?  Tattoo Stan junior.
So he did.. I don't even know why I'm telling you about Tattoo Stan..
No nor do I, Karl, to be honest.

Hey, I don't know that it.. maybe you just have to picture this, but my sister had to take a photo once, she was working in like a factory.
